unnormalised: The construction of the new flyover at the Hebbal junction in Bangalore is facing yet another delay, mainly because they are haggling over 2.5 mm of something or other. Seriously, how long is it going to take?
normalised: The construction of the new flyover at the Hebbal junction in Bangalore is facing yet another delay, mainly because they are haggling over two point five millimeter of something or other. Seriously, how long is it going to take?

unnormalised: Apparently, the initial plans called for girders of a certain spec, but then there was a change order somewhere, and now the whole thing is stuck in limbo. The engineers are saying that this difference in thickness impacts the load-bearing capacity of the entire structure. I mean, 2.5 mm doesn't *sound* like much, but what do I know?
normalised: Apparently, the initial plans called for girders of a certain spec, but then there was a change order somewhere, and now the whole thing is stuck in limbo. The engineers are saying that this difference in thickness impacts the load-bearing capacity of the entire structure. I mean, two point five millimeter doesn't sound like much, but what do I know?

unnormalised: The whole project is now running almost 2 years behind schedule, and the cost has already ballooned by about Rs. 30 crore. And don't even get me started on the traffic! Getting through Hebbal during peak hours is a nightmare - easily takes 45 minutes to cover a distance that should ideally take just 10.
normalised: The whole project is now running almost two years behind schedule, and the cost has already ballooned by about rupee thirty crore. And don't even get me started on the traffic! Getting through Hebbal during peak hours is a nightmare - easily takes forty five minutes to cover a distance that should ideally take just ten.

unnormalised: Local residents are understandably furious. "We were promised that this flyover would ease congestion, but it's just making things worse," said Ms. Sharma, a regular commuter. "They keep giving us dates – Dec 2023, then March 2024 – and then nothing happens.
normalised: Local residents are understandably furious. "We were promised that this flyover would ease congestion, but it's just making things worse," said M-s. Sharma, a regular commuter. "They keep giving us dates – december two thousand twenty three, then march two thousand twenty four – and then nothing happens.

unnormalised: The contractors, M/s ABC Constructions, are blaming material shortages and bureaucratic delays. They say that the revised specifications require a special grade of steel that is not readily available in the required quantity. Apparently, the steel needs to withstand tensile stress of 550 MPa.
normalised: The contractors, M-s A-B-C Constructions, are blaming material shortages and bureaucratic delays. They say that the revised specifications require a special grade of steel that is not readily available in the required quantity. Apparently, the steel needs to withstand tensile stress of five hundred and fifty M-P-A.

unnormalised: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) is reportedly looking into the matter and has promised to expedite the process. But honestly, I will believe it when I see it. These things always seem to take much longer than anyone anticipates.
normalised: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (B-B-M-P) is reportedly looking into the matter and has promised to expedite the process. But honestly, I will believe it when I see it. These things always seem to take much longer than anyone anticipates.

unnormalised: In the meantime, citizens are stuck with endless traffic jams. Maybe they should have just stuck with the original plans – even if it meant girders that were 2.5 mm thinner. At least we would have a flyover by now. Construction will be done by 15th Oct 2024, sources say.
normalised: In the meantime, citizens are stuck with endless traffic jams. Maybe they should have just stuck with the original plans – even if it meant girders that were two point five millimeter thinner. At least we would have a flyover by now. Construction will be done by fifteenth october two thousand twenty four, sources say.
